ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English spinache, from Old French espinache, from Medieval Latin spinacia, ultimately from Arabic إِسْفَانَاخ (ʾisfānāḵ), derived from Persian اسپاناخ (aspânâx).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A widely cultivated edible plant of the amaranth family, having dark green leaves rich in iron and vitamins, typically cooked or eaten raw in salads.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种广泛种植的可食用植物（菠菜），属于苋科，叶子深绿色，富含铁和维生素，通常煮熟或生食于沙拉中。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She ordered the pasta with cream sauce and sautéed spinach.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她点了一份奶油酱意面和炒菠菜。
